title: How to Use iPhone Speakerphone to Answer or Make Calls

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Phone app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Phone app. Tap the Phone app icon, which is a white phone receiver on a green background. [1] X Research source You can also use this method during an active call. Just skip down to step 4 if you're already on a call.

steps.title: Dial a number or select a contact.
steps.content: Dial a number or select a contact. Tap the Contacts tab to select a contact from your contact list, or use the Keypad tab to dial a phone number. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Start a phone call.
steps.content: Start a phone call. Tap your contact's phone number to place the call or tap the green call button to call the number you've dialed. [3] X Research source If you dialed a number, just tap the green call button at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Speaker.
steps.content: Tap Speaker . It's in the upper-right corner of the grid of call buttons. Doing so will turn on your iPhone's speaker, allowing you to hold the phone away from your face while still being able to talk and listen. The speaker icon will turn white and remain that way while you're in speaker mode. If you don't see any options on the screen, move your phone a few feet away from your face. Holding the iPhone close to your face will prompt the screen to turn off. If your iPhone's dial pad is still on-screen, tap Hide in the bottom-right corner of the dial pad to hide it and show the call buttons. If you're connected to a Bluetooth speaker (e.g., the speaker in your car), tapping the speaker icon will prompt a pop-up menu at the bottom of the screen, at which point you'll have to tap Speaker to switch to your iPhone's speaker. If you want to switch back to handset mode, just tap Speaker again. The icon will turn gray.

steps.title: Swipe right or tap Accept.
steps.content: Swipe right or tap Accept . When you receive a call, you'll either see the option to tap Accept or swipe right on the phone slider to answer. As soon as you answer the call, you'll see a menu with several options on the screen. [4] X Research source Don't hold the phone up to your face just yet, as the options screen will disappear. If you don't see options like Mute, Keypad, and Speaker, move the phone a few feet from your face until the options appear.

steps.title: Tap Speaker.
steps.content: Tap Speaker . It's the option with a small speaker icon at the top-right corner of the option grid. The icon will turn white to indicate that you're now on speakerphone. If you're connected to a Bluetooth speaker (e.g., the speaker in your car), tapping the speaker icon will prompt a pop-up menu at the bottom of the screen, at which point you'll have to tap Speaker to switch to your iPhone's speaker. If you want to switch back to handset mode, just tap Speaker again. The icon will turn gray.

steps.title: Move your iPhone away from your face.
steps.content: Move your iPhone away from your face. If you're already on a call and have your iPhone near your face, the screen will go dark. You can reactivate the screen just by moving it at least a foot or two away.

steps.title: Tap Speaker.
steps.content: Tap Speaker . You'll see this option at the top-right corner of the option grid. This instantly puts your call on speakerphone. The speaker icon will turn white to indicate that you're using speakerphone. If you want to switch back to handset mode, just tap Speaker again. The icon will turn gray.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. Tap the Settings app icon, which resembles a set of gears on a grey box. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accessibility.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility . This section is in the middle of the third grouping of options and is represented by a small stick figure inside a circle, set against a blue background. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Touch.
steps.content: Tap Touch . It's the first option listed beneath the section labeled "Physical and Motor." [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Call Audio Routing.
steps.content: Tap Call Audio Routing . It is listed towards the bottom of the "Touch" page. This section determines where audio will be heard while on a call or FaceTime audio. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Speaker.
steps.content: Tap Speaker . This option is at the bottom of the "Call Audio Routing" menu. You should see a checkmark appear to the left of Speaker , signifying that it is the default call audio option now. [9] X Research source With this option enabled, all incoming or outgoing calls will automatically use the speaker. You'll still be able to turn off the speaker by tapping speaker during the call.
